title: How to Make Ube (Purple Yam)

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325 °F (163 °C).
steps.description: Line bottom of cake pan with parchment paper. Do not spray with cooking spray. This somehow makes the flavor go away.

steps.headline: Mix the baking powder, salt, and flour in a bowl.
Put grated ube, 3/4 cup milk, and 1 tsp.
steps.description: vanilla in a bowl and blend until the mixture is smooth.

steps.headline: Add the yolks, oil, and corn syrup.
steps.description: After this is smooth, add in mixture from step 2 and blend until this is smooth. Set aside.

steps.headline: Meanwhile, beat the egg whites with cream of tartar in a bowl.
steps.description: Slowly add the sugar and both food colorings one at a time. Beat until it is stiff.

steps.headline: Fold 1/3 of the whites into the  batter from step 4.
steps.description: Quickly fold in the rest of the whites until none are left. Pour batter into prepared pans.

steps.headline: Bake for 30 - 35 minutes.
steps.description: Or, until the center bounces back when you poke it with your finger.

steps.headline: When cool, cut sections and place coconut shreds in the middle (optional).

text: Preheat the oven to 325 °F (163 °C). Line bottom of cake pan with parchment paper. Do not spray with cooking spray. This somehow makes the flavor go away. Mix the baking powder, salt, and flour in a bowl. Set this aside for later. Put grated ube, 3/4 cup milk, and 1 tsp. vanilla in a bowl and blend until the mixture is smooth. Add the yolks, oil, and corn syrup. After this is smooth, add in mixture from step 2 and blend until this is smooth. Set aside. Meanwhile, beat the egg whites with cream of tartar in a bowl. Slowly add the sugar and both food colorings one at a time. Beat until it is stiff. Fold 1/3 of the whites into the  batter from step 4. Quickly fold in the rest of the whites until none are left. Pour batter into prepared pans. Bake for 30 - 35 minutes. Or, until the center bounces back when you poke it with your finger. When cool, cut sections and place coconut shreds in the middle (optional). You may add icing. Finished.
